item.title: Japan (!) now slated to have the highest birthrate in East Asia
item.description:
Mike Bird on Twitter

“Japan was once known for ultra-low birthrates. Though still low, it now actually has the highest fertility rate in developed E. Asia, and is tied with China, where fertility is still tumbling. Not having a 20x house-price/income may help. https://t.co/dgu7pnTwdF”

URL: https://twitter.com/Birdyword/status/1527321785532055552

item.title: Is the hurricane problem increasing in severity?
item.description:
Patrick T. Brown on Twitter

“I listened to two @nytimes The Daily podcasts on topics related to climate change and hurricanes this week. Both give the overwhelming impression that we have seen substantial increases in hurricane strength/frequency. That’s just not true.”

URL: https://twitter.com/PatrickTBrown31/status/1600220583605587968

item.title: Thread on the weird German coup

Sergej Sumlenny on Twitter

“THREAD I see that many of those who don’t live in Germany, are not aware of the “Reichsbürger” (Imperial Citizens) far-right movement, as its members were arrested today for the alleged preparation of a coup. Let me start this thread on the details of this conspiracy theory 1/x”

URL: https://twitter.com/sumlenny/status/1600511558777540613
